0.title: They hit me in the crotch, locked me up in the loo of a jail: Arnab Goswami on his arrest
0.article_body: Republic TV's Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami, while speaking about his arrest in November 2020, said, "They were pushing me with the butt of their weapons, hitting me in the crotch, thrashing me and not even letting me wear my shoes." "[They locked] me up in the loo of a jail, [did] things which are unbelievable," he added.

1.title: Goa CM urges citizens to encourage 'vocal for local' initiative this Diwali
1.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Saturday urged citizens to encourage the "vocal for local" initiative and consider local products while shopping for Diwali festival. "It may be akashkandil (lantern), eatables or even flowers, always choose to buy items that are made locally," he said. Sawant said that he himself has put up a lantern made of coconut tree leaves.

2.title: Robin Uthappa names his 4 semi-finalists of T20 World Cup 2022, excludes India
2.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper-batter Robin Uthappa has named four teams which according to him will be the semi-finalists at the ongoing T20 World Cup 2022. "My semi-finalists would be Australia, England, Pakistan, and South Africa," said Uthappa. On excluding India, Uthappa said, "I do not think [Indian fans] would be too happy [with my prediction]."

3.title: Pilots sent 'Mayday' call moments before Army helicopter crash in Arunachal
3.article_body: Pilots of an Indian Army helicopter, which crashed in Arunachal Pradesh's Upper Siang, killing five, had issued a 'Mayday' call to the Air Traffic Control (ATC). According to officials, the pilot had reached out to the ATC flagging a technical failure in the aircraft. "It is reported that the weather was good for flying operations," a Defence spokesperson said.

4.title: Kids of photojournalist Danish, who was killed in Afghanistan, receive his Pulitzer Prize
4.article_body: Reuters photojournalist Danish Siddiqui's children accepted the Pulitzer Prize on his behalf. Danish Siddiqui was killed while covering the Afghanistan conflict in July last year. Yunus Siddiqui, 6, Sarah Siddiqui, 4, children of the late Danish Siddiqui received the award in a ceremony in New York. He was also awarded the Pulitzer Prize in 2018.

5.title: Are BSF jawans eating biryani and sleeping at the border?: Owaisi
5.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi questioned the Centre and BSF after the RSS blamed infiltration for an alleged population imbalance in India. "If people are coming from Bangladesh, what are your BSF jawans doing at the border? Eating biryani and sleeping?" questioned Owaisi. The RSS claimed that conversion and Bangladeshi migrants were the primary reasons behind the alleged population imbalance.

6.title: Ashok Gehlot hosts Diwali lunch for kids who lost parents to COVID-19
6.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Friday hosted a Diwali programme for more than 200 children who recently lost both their parents to COVID-19. The programme, reportedly organised at his residence, included a luncheon, a magic show and other activities. The 71-year-old leader was seen interacting with children and participating in games with them. He said children were also given gifts.

7.title: Magnitude 5.5 earthquake hits China's western Sichuan region
7.article_body: A 5.5-magnitude earthquake struck the western part of China's Sichuan province on Saturday, the European Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMSC) said. The earthquake's focus was located at a depth of 80 km, the EMSC informed. Last month, on September 5, an earthquake of magnitude 6.8 struck Luding County in Sichuan province causing the death of 93 people and injuring hundreds.

8.title: 7 persons injured in blast at Bharat Petroleum oil depot near Bhopal
8.article_body: Seven persons sustained injuries in a blast that occurred at the Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited's (BPCL) depot on the outskirts of Bhopal in Madhya Pradesh, police said on Saturday. "Six of the injured persons are either drivers or helpers of the Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL), who were there to get fuel filled in their tankers," an officer said.

9.title: MCG pitch should make for a really good IND-PAK game: Curator
9.article_body: Ahead of the India-Pakistan match in Melbourne on Sunday, MCG pitch curator Michael Salvatore said that the wicket should make for a really good game between the two sides. "So we have drop-in wickets here at the MCG. So for the cricket season, we bring the wickets in and I sit on some sand and bed in nicely," Salvatore said.

10.title: It's a challenge for India to come out on top in ICC tournaments: Rohit
10.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma said it's a challenge for the team to come out on top in ICC tournaments given their record in the last nine years. India haven't won an ICC trophy since MS Dhoni-led India won Champions Trophy in 2013. Rohit added that his side have the opportunity to do well in ongoing T20 World Cup in Australia.

11.title: We were completely outplayed: Aus captain on loss vs NZ in T20 WC 2022
11.article_body: After Australia's 89-run defeat against New Zealand in their first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match, Australia captain Aaron Finch said his side was completely outplayed. He added that New Zealand openers set the tone in the first four overs and the defending champions didn't recover. Chasing 201, Australia were bowled out for 111 in 17.1 overs.

12.title: Percentage of NCR houses bursting crackers this Diwali could be highest in 5 yrs: Survey
12.article_body: The percentage of households in Delhi-NCR that will burst firecrackers on Diwali could be the highest in five years, according to a survey. The survey, which was conducted by LocalCircles, said two of every five families are likely to burst crackers. About 10% of the surveyed said they had bought crackers from shops in Delhi.

13.title: Delhi Police officer's daughter arrested for hitting man with car
13.article_body: A senior Delhi Police official's daughter was arrested on Saturday for allegedly hitting a parking valet with her car earlier this week at a mall in Delhi's Saket area, ANI reported. The incident was reportedly caught on surveillance cameras. The woman's car allegedly ran over the valet's legs while he was attending to a customer, leaving him injured.

14.title: KL Rahul is correct enough to rack up runs in T20 WC 2022: Pietersen
14.article_body: Kevin Pietersen has predicted India opener KL Rahul to end T20 World Cup 2022 as the highest run-scorer. "With the ball bouncing, swinging and seaming, I think he plays in a very authentic way and is correct enough to rack up the runs," said Pietersen. "He is the number one batter in the world at the moment," he added.

15.title: Former village head shot over political rivalry in UP
15.article_body: A former village head was shot in Ballan village in Banda, UP on Saturday. The accused, Bhanjan Singh (56), has been arrested in connection with the incident, which seems to have taken place allegedly over a political rivalry, police said. The victim, Omkar Dwivedi (54), was rushed to the Kanpur medical college where his condition remains critical, police added.

16.title: Former Pune Municipal Commissioner blames "slothful" citizens for flooding
16.article_body: Former Pune Municipal Commissioner Mahesh Zagade has blamed "clueless" civic body officials and "slothful" citizens for the recent flooding and traffic chaos in the city. "I will not blame the politicians for the mess Pune city finds itself in. I will instead blame Pune's fast asleep citizens and clueless PMC officials for the nightmare," Zagade said.

17.title: DCP Bhagyashree Navtake to take charge of Pune traffic branch
17.article_body: Commissioner of Police, Pune, Amitabh Gupta has ordered Deputy Commissioner of Police (Economic Offences Wing and Cyber Cell) Bhagyashree Navtake to take charge of the traffic branch. The decision was taken even as DCP (Traffic) Rahul Shrirame continues in his post. According to the order, Shrirame will have to "submit a report to Navtake regarding traffic work".

18.title: Noida Traffic Police issues advisory for festive period
18.article_body: The Noida Traffic Police has issued a traffic advisory for the festive period of Dhanteras, Diwali and Bhai Dooj. According to which, Indira Market, Atta Market, Sector 18 Market, Gurudwara, Gardens Galleria Mall, GIP Mall and surrounding areas are no parking zones. The stretch from Attapir Chowk to Car Market Sector 28 will be banned for rickshaws from 2 pm.

19.title: Journalist asks 'Are all players singing 'Rain Rain Go Away'?', Babar's response goes viral
19.article_body: A video of Pakistan captain Babar Azam's response to a journalist asking "Are all players singing 'Rain Rain Go Away?'" ahead of India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match in Melbourne went viral. "No sir...We aren't singing lullaby to...child," Babar joked. He added weather isn't in players' hands. There are 70% chances of rain in Melbourne on Sunday, as per forecast.

20.title: Man uses B'luru sexologist's identity to harass women with pics on FB
20.article_body: A 35-year-old man was arrested last week for misusing the identity of a renowned sexologist in Bengaluru on social media. The arrest was made after medical practitioner Dr Padmini Prasad lodged a complaint with cyber police. According to police, the accused created fake Facebook accounts in the name of Prasad to approach women and harass them with messages and pictures.

21.title: Bengaluru has received 311 mm of rainfall in October so far: IMD
21.article_body: In October, Bengaluru has so far received 311 mm of rainfall, which is a deviation of 189 mm from the normal, as per the India Meteorological Department (IMD). Further, Bengaluru has already received 1,795.5 mm of rainfall this year. "Owing to increasing concretisation, the rainfall pattern has...been erratic and the city is receiving heavy rainfall," an IMD scientist said.

22.title: Curran creates history, becomes 1st England bowler to take a 5-wicket haul in T20Is
22.article_body: England's 24-year-old all-rounder Sam Curran has created history by becoming the first-ever England bowler to take a five-wicket haul in T20I cricket. Curran registered bowling figures of 3.4-0-10-5 against Afghanistan in England's first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Saturday to achieve the feat. His figures helped England bowl Afghanistan out for 112 in 19.4 overs.

23.title: Hyderabad Police arrest 3 vehicle thieves; 2 cars, 2 bikes seized
23.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Friday arrested three vehicle thieves, identified as Syed Ahmed, Syed Omer and Shaik Ameer. Police recovered two Indica cars and two bikes from the accused. Another accused, identified as Jaffar, is currently absconding, the police stated in a press release. Two accused and recovered vehicles were handed over to Cyberabad Police for further action, police stated.

24.title: Two arrested after police raid Thane spa for vulgar activities
24.article_body: The Mira Bhayandar-Vasai Virar Police raided a spa on Mira Road that was alleged to be indulging in vulgar activities under the guise of massage services. Acting on a tip-off, the police deputed a decoy customer to bust the racket and arrested a female employee and an operator. The Ank Luxurious Salon and Spa is located in the Kanakia area.

25.title: Indian campaign ends at Denmark Open as Lakshya loses in quarters
25.article_body: Commonwealth Games 2022 gold medal-winning shuttler Lakshya Sen crashed out of Denmark Open 2022 on Friday. The 21-year-old lost to Japan's Kodai Naraoka 17-21, 12-21 in the men's singles quarter-final. With this, the Indian campaign ended in Odense. Earlier in the day, Indian men's doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty lost in the quarter-final.

26.title: NMMC seizes over 1.40 lakh kg of single-use plastic in last 3 months
26.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) has seized over 1.40 lakh kg of plastic in the last three months, the highest since the state banned single-use plastic in 2018. Last week, civic officials seized over 800 kg of banned plastic from a wholesale seller. The team also caught the female salesperson selling plastic bags to vendors and hawkers every day.

27.title: Villagers bathe in mud water to protest against bad roads in Karnataka
27.article_body: Locals took bath in the mud water accumulated on a road in Karnataka's Hulikeri village to protest against the poor condition of roads in the area. The protesters also shouted slogans against the authorities. They claimed officials have taken no action despite repeated requests from villagers. A nearly four km stretch of road is currently flooded in the area.

28.title: Manage glucose confidently this festive season: Abbott FreeStyle Libre
28.article_body: Abbott's FreeStyle Libre is a sensor-based continuous glucose monitoring device that helps people with diabetes track their glucose levels. This wearable product monitors glucose levels without fingerpricks & calculates time spent in the desired range. It enables users make informed decisions on lifestyle modifications and dietary control, owing to the ease of sharing real-time data with experts.

29.title: Solid start for their campaign: Irfan on NZ's 89-run win vs Aus in T20 WC
29.article_body: Reacting to New Zealand's 89-run win against Australia in T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage, Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Kiwis dominated the game from the first over. Solid start for their campaign." Wasim Jaffer said, "New Zealand beat Australia and declare the T20 World Cup open!!" Ian Bishop tweeted, "Fantastic opening performance by 2021 runners-up against the defending champs."

30.title: Argentina fear no one at 2022 FIFA World Cup: Messi
30.article_body: Argentinian skipper Lionel Messi said that his side fears no one at the upcoming 2022 FIFA World Cup. "Today we are doing well and people are excited and think that we will come back with the WC, but it is not like that," Messi said. He added, "WC is very difficult, many things have to happen [to win it]."

31.title: Crypto exchange Gate.io's Twitter compromised to promote fake giveaway: Report
31.article_body: Hackers of unknown origin gained control of the official Twitter account of cryptocurrency exchange Gate.io and altered the website URL to a fraudulent website mimicking the exchange, Cointelegraph reported. The fake website reportedly promoted a fake giveaway of 500,000 USDT and asked users to connect their wallets. Rewards are used as a pretext to gain access to users' personal funds.

32.title: UK lawmaker Matheson resigns over ‘unwanted sexual advances’
32.article_body: UK lawmaker Christian Matheson has resigned after a parliamentary watchdog recommended his suspension over "serious sexual misconduct". The watchdog said Matheson had breached parliament's sexual misconduct policy by making "unwanted and unwelcome" advances towards a junior staff member. Matheson allegedly invited the colleague on a private trip abroad, which was found to be "sexually motivated".

33.title: AIIMS Delhi chief issues order to stop vendors from sending him gifts
33.article_body: AIIMS Delhi Director, Dr M Srinivas, has directed the medical college and hospital's security and administration officials to not let representatives of vendors, contractors and agencies into his office with gifts on festive occasions. "I do not accept gifts or greetings from such people," the newly-appointed AIIMS Delhi chief said in an order, as per media reports.

34.title: Pic shows remains of a supernova, Instagram user says 'Beyond beautiful'
34.article_body: NASA shared a composite image showing the remains of a supernova, around 9,000 light-years from Earth, in three bands of X-ray light detected by Chandra X-ray Observatory telescope. It shows low energy X-rays in red, medium in green, and the highest in blue. "Beyond beautiful...space is magical and mysterious," an Instagram user commented, while another comment read, "This is awesome."

35.title: MP CM Shivraj Chouhan to celebrate Diwali with COVID orphans at his residence
35.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that he would celebrate Diwali at his residence with children who lost their parents due to COVID-19. "I will celebrate the festival of Diwali with my sons, daughters, nephews, and nieces who have lost their parents...I feel happy to celebrate the festival with them and to share happiness with them," said Chouhan.

36.title: 150 bottles of premium foreign liquor seized in excise raids in Delhi
36.article_body: The Delhi government's excise department has arrested five people and registered three separate FIRs in connection with the adulteration of high-end foreign liquor. Almost 150 bottles of premium foreign liquor and 20 empty bottles were recovered during the raids. The gang included some bartenders who mixed premium foreign liquor with cheap Indian Made Foreign Liquor (IMFL) for sale purposes.

37.title: RSS raising religious conversion issue to divert attention: BSP chief
37.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Saturday alleged that RSS is raising issues related to religious conversion and population policy to divert people's attention from failures of BJP-led government at Centre. She said it is an irony that the RSS supports the BJP in every election with its "eyes closed". "Its silence on the prevailing atmosphere in the country is...harmful," Mayawati said.

38.title: 3 members of disbanded Hong Kong pro-democracy group jailed
38.article_body: Three members of the now-disbanded Hong Kong pro-democracy student group, Student Politicism, have been sentenced to up to three years in prison for conspiracy to incite subversion. The activists, aged 19 to 21, were accused of making speeches and handing out leaflets urging public to overthrow the Chinese government. Wong Yat-chin, Chan Chi-sum and Jessica Chu pleaded guilty in July.

39.title: 4 friends celebrating a birthday drown in pond at temple in Thane
39.article_body: Four of five friends from Mumbai who had gone to Thane to celebrate a birthday drowned in a pond next to the Kondeshwar Shiv temple on Friday. According to police, the friends jumped into the pond unaware that it was deep after a certain point. One of them, 19-year-old Pratik Hate, managed to swim to safety, but the remaining drowned.

40.title: 59-year-old Mumbai man loses leg while trying to board BEST bus
40.article_body: A 59-year-old resident of Mumbai, Surendra Shinde, lost his left leg while he was trying to board a BEST bus in Sewri area on October 18. He was admitted to KEM Hospital where his leg was amputated below the knee. "His right leg was on the steps, but due to the jerking movement...the loose sheet crushed his...leg," Shinde's relative said.

41.title: Bank of Baroda-backed IndiaFirst Life Insurance files DRHP with SEBI for IPO
41.article_body: IndiaFirst Life Insurance, backed by Bank of Baroda (BoB) filed its draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with SEBI for an IPO this year. The IPO will comprise a fresh issue of ₹500 crore and an offer for sale of 14.12 crore shares. BoB has a 65% stake in the life insurer and Union Bank of India has a 9% stake.

42.title: H'wood filmmaker approaches Vipul Amrutlal Shah for remake rights of 'Sanak'
42.article_body: Hollywood filmmaker Kylan Tyng has approached filmmaker Vipul Amrutlal Shah for the remake rights of 'Sanak', a 2021 action-thriller film which featured Vidyut Jammwal and Neha Dhupia, among others. Talking about it, Vipul said, "I'm the only person whose two films have been inquired [about] by Hollywood for remakes...I am super excited and I really hope that this will materialise."

43.title: PM Modi, Amit Shah, Nadda among BJP campaigners for Himachal polls
43.article_body: The BJP on Friday released a list of 40 campaigners for the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. The list features Prime Minister Narendra Modi, party chief JP Nadda, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Home Minister Amit Shah. Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath and Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar are also included in the list.

44.title: India's growth, stability concerns are less than that of world: Finance Ministry
44.article_body: Estimating India's medium-term growth rate above 6%, the Finance Ministry said, the country's growth and stability concerns are less than that of the world at large. "A long-awaited domestic investment cycle that had started will accelerate once current external shocks – geopolitical conflicts and monetary tightening – fade...Corporate and bank balance sheets in India are ready for it.," it said.

45.title: Akshay shares fan's Phir Hera Pheri-inspired rangoli, says 'I love it'
45.article_body: Akshay Kumar responded to a fan who had tweeted a picture of a rangoli inspired by a scene from his film 'Phir Hera Pheri'. "Dear @akshaykumar, award winning rangoli in my office. I hope you like this," the fan wrote. Akshay responded, "Like this? I love it! Hope it brings a smile on all...visitors' faces like it did on mine."

46.title: Half of Ukraine's thermal production stations hit by Russian strikes: Min
46.article_body:
Ukrainian Energy Minister German Galushchenko said Russian air strikes have hit at least half of Ukraine's thermal generation capacity since October 10, resulting in billions of dollars in damage. 
However, not all of these thermal power plants have entirely stopped production, Galushchenko told Reuters. He further said that Ukraine may need electricity imports to get through the winter.

47.title: ICICI Bank's Q2 profit up by 37% to ₹7,558 cr as bad loan provisions fall
47.article_body: ICICI Bank posted a 37% year-on-year growth in standalone profit at ₹7,557.84 crore for the September quarter as against ₹5,511 crore in the corresponding period last year led by a fall in bad loan provisions. Its net interest income surged to ₹14,787 crore year-on-year compared to ₹11,690 crore last year. It registered a 25% year-on-year growth in retail loan portfolio.

48.title: Industrialist, wife & teenage daughter set themselves ablaze in B'luru
48.article_body: An industrialist, his wife and their teenage daughter died after allegedly setting themselves ablaze in Bengaluru's HSR Layout on Friday. The family from Kerala had shifted to Bengaluru a few years ago. Police said the industrialist, Santosh, ran a small tool manufacturing factory. Losses in business and failure to repay loans are the prime reasons behind the suicide, they added.

49.title: BJP will win more seats in Gujarat than last time: Anurag Thakur
49.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur exuded confidence that the BJP will win the upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls and said that the party will win more seats than last time. He claimed that AAP would not be able to win a single seat in the polls. "AAP has nothing. The states in which they've formed governments are in bad shape," said Thakur.

50.title: Ask your MP to quit being Dy Chairman of RS: Kishor to Bihar CM
50.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor accused Bihar CM Nitish Kumar of continuing to be in touch with the BJP. "If you have nothing to do with BJP/ NDA then ask your MP to quit the post of Deputy Chairman of Rajya Sabha," tweeted Kishor, talking about JD(U)'s Harivansh. CM Kumar had denied the allegations and said Kishor was speaking for publicity.

51.title: Pregnant woman, mother killed as ambulance hits tree in Tamil Nadu
51.article_body: A 20-year-old pregnant woman and her mother were killed after an ambulance they were in crashed into a tree in Tamil Nadu's Sivaganga district on Friday. The woman was reportedly in labour when she was travelling with her family members in the vehicle. Three other people are being treated at a hospital.

52.title: AAP Corporator Sejal Malaviya bites female security guard at Surat meeting
52.article_body: An AAP Corporator, Sejal Malaviya, reportedly bit a female security guard when she was being moved out of a meeting of the Surat Municipal Corporation's General Board in Surat. Reports said that the incident took place on Friday when BJP leader Amit Rajput tried to raise the oath issue involving Delhi's former Social Justice Minister Rajendra Pal Gautam.

53.title: Cognizant promoted 42,000 employees in FY22, spent $130 mn in hikes: Report
53.article_body: IT company Cognizant promoted around 42,000 employees in FY22 and spent $130 million (over ₹1,000 crore) in the year for merit-based and off-cycle increments, ToI reported citing an MCA filing. It also promoted 13,810 employees up to associate director levels, spending $36 million, an average increase of 14%. It also rolled out target merit assessment effective from July last year.

54.title: Texas state police fire 1st officer over Uvalde shooting which killed 19 kids
54.article_body: Texas Department of Public Safety has fired a policeman who was at the scene of the Uvalde school massacre in which 19 children and two teachers were killed. Juan Maldonado is the first state police force member to be fired in the case. A gunman armed with AR-15-style rifle went on a shooting rampage at Robb Elementary School in May.

55.title: Nigerian DJ on student visa in Pune arrested for overstay in India
55.article_body: Pune City Police has arrested the 31-year-old Nigerian DJ 'Echo Buzz' for allegedly overstaying in India. The accused had come to India on a student visa a few years ago to study at Fergusson College, police said. The DJ stayed at a housing complex in Kondhwa's Yewalewadi area and has been overstaying in the country since 2014, police added.

56.title: 978 colonies within Hyderabad ORR to receive water by March 2023
56.article_body: The work related to providing water supply to 978 colonies, located outside Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) limits and within Outer Ring Road (ORR), is set to be finished by March 2023. "While...construction of reservoirs is underway, the water distribution network will be built simultaneously so...there are no delays," Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board MD said.

57.title: 70,000 jobs 'oont ke muh me jeera': Surjewala on PM's Rozgar Mela
57.article_body: As PM Modi launched Rozgar Mela in which appointment letters are to be handed over to 75,000 people, the Congress called it "oont ke muh me jeera". Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "Modiji, you promised two crore jobs every year, which makes it 16 crore jobs in eight years...The youth want employment. Rahul Gandhi will keep raising their questions."

58.title: NZ record their biggest-ever T20 WC victory, win a match in Australia after 10 years
58.article_body: New Zealand defeated Australia by 89 runs in their first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Saturday. It is New Zealand's biggest-ever victory (by runs) in T20 World Cup history. Further, New Zealand have registered a victory in international cricket on Australian soil after more than 10 years.

59.title: A photographer jumped on car's bonnet for Aishwarya's pic, could've died: Jaya
59.article_body: Jaya Bachchan recalled how a photographer "could have died" while trying to take Aishwarya Rai's picture after her wedding in 2007. She said, "The day we were bringing Aishwarya...for 'griha pravesh', [Amitabh] was driving the car...We'd created...podium for...media, so that they could take pictures...One guy jumped on...bonnet of car...[Amitabh] lost his cool...our security took these people on."

60.title: API, constable booked for demanding bribe of ₹50,000 in Pune
60.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) officials booked an assistant police inspector (API) and a police constable in Pune for demanding a bribe of ₹50,000. The constable demanded the bribe from a 27-year-old complainant for helping by not arresting his family members in a case registered against them and the API assisted him in the crime, ACB officials said.

61.title: Taliban forces kill 6 Islamic State members in raid in Kabul
61.article_body: Taliban forces killed six Islamic State members in an overnight raid on their hideout in Afghanistan's capital, Kabul, a Taliban spokesperson said on Saturday. The slain Islamic State members were involved in two major attacks in recent weeks, one on a mosque near Kabul's former "Green Zone" and the other on a tutoring institute in the city, the spokesperson added.

62.title: Giorgia Meloni sworn in as Italy's 1st female Prime Minister
62.article_body: Giorgia Meloni was sworn in as Italy's first female Prime Minister at the presidential palace on Saturday. Meloni has been politically active since she was a teenage activist in a neo-fascist party's youth wing in Rome. In 2008, Meloni became Italy's youngest ever minister in Silvio Berlusconi's government.

63.title: Conway breaks Kohli's record for smashing highest T20I score by a visiting batter in Aus
63.article_body: New Zealand opener Devon Conway on Saturday broke Virat Kohli's record for smashing the highest T20I score by a visiting batter in Australia. Conway scored 92*(58) against Australia in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Sydney to break the record. Kohli had set the previous record by scoring 90*(55) against Australia in Adelaide in 2016.

64.title: Japan, Australia leaders sign new security pact amid China threat
64.article_body: Australian PM Anthony Albanese and his Japanese counterpart Fumio Kishida on Saturday signed a new bilateral security agreement amid China's growing military presence in the Asia-Pacific region. The two countries vowed to share more sensitive intelligence and conduct joint war games. "This landmark declaration sends a strong signal to the region of our strategic alignment," Albanese said.

65.title: Ex-UK PM Boris Johnson flies back from holiday to run for office
65.article_body: Former UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson, who was on holiday in the Caribbean, has flown back to Britain to run for office for the second time. This comes as his successor, Liz Truss, stepped down after serving for 45 days. Johnson received support of dozens of Conservative lawmakers but needs to secure 100 nominations to be considered for the race.

66.title: Balaji Telefilms' ex-COO who went missing may have been killed, claims Kenyan Prez's aide
66.article_body: An aide of Kenyan President William Ruto has claimed that the two missing Indians in Kenya have been killed by the disbanded DCI unit, a report said. Balaji Telefilms' ex-COO Zulfiqar Ahmad Khan and his friend Mohamed Zaid Sami Kidwai went missing alongside taxi driver Nicodemus Mwania in July. India has been in touch with Kenyan authorities on the matter.

67.title: Salman Khan recovering from dengue, to take a break from Bigg Boss 16: Report
67.article_body: Actor Salman Khan was diagnosed with dengue a few days ago and is currently on a break from his work commitments, as per reports. In his absence, Bigg Boss OTT host Karan Johar took over the weekend special episode of Bigg Boss 16. Salman is reportedly recovering and will soon get back to work.

68.title: Video of grand laser show in Ayodhya ahead of Diwali goes viral
68.article_body: A video of a grand laser show in UP's Ayodhya ahead of Diwali has gone viral on social media. The event was organised as part of the Deepotsav celebration, which Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to visit on Sunday. During his visit, PM Modi will also conduct an inspection of the Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra's site.

69.title: Captaining is a big thing for me: Rohit ahead of India's T20 WC opener vs Pak
69.article_body: Asked about leading India ahead of their T20 World Cup 2022 opener against Pakistan, Rohit Sharma said, "Captaining is a big thing for me, but playing any game for India is important for me." He added, "Occasions keep changing. I've played...World Cup final once, against Pakistan in 2007." The T20 World Cup is Rohit's first World Cup as captain.

70.title: 4 killed, 3 injured after jeep crashes into pole in MP's Shajapur
70.article_body: Four people were killed and three injured after their speeding jeep crashed into a pole in Madhya Pradesh's Shajapur district, said police on Saturday. Four of the victims died on the spot, while the other three were admitted to a government hospital, said a police official. A probe into the incident has been initiated, added the official.

71.title: ₹1.10 cr hawala cash found in Chevrolet Spark car in Hyd, 4 arrested
71.article_body: Hyderabad Police found hawala cash worth over ₹1.10 crore in a Chevrolet Spark car and arrested four people for possessing unaccounted money on Thursday. The main accused, Kamlesh Kumar, is a resident of Chudibazar. Police said he had hatched a plan to run hawala business in and around Hyderabad as he wasn't getting enough profit from his plastic bag business.

72.title: 6-yr-old succumbs to burn injuries after Pune hotel catches fire
72.article_body: A six-year-old girl, Iqra Naeem Khan, died in a fire accident at a hotel near Bhikardas Maruti Temple in the Sadashiv Peth area of Pune. She was shifted to a private hospital, where she succumbed to the burn injuries. The cause of the fire and the extent of the damage have not been identified so far.

73.title: Feels nice to get praise for a rooted, regional film: Rishab on 'Kantara'
73.article_body: Rishab Shetty in an interview thanked Kangana Ranaut for praising his film 'Kantara'. He added that it "feels nice to get praise for a rooted, regional film". "This is the story of my village...It's being loved across the globe...People are talking...about our beliefs, tradition, culture, ritual, way of life," Rishab added. Kangana had said she was "shaking" after watching 'Kantara'.

74.title: Rishi Sunak is the only man for UK PM job: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw
74.article_body: Biocon Limited's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw has said that Indian-origin Rishi Sunak "is the only man for the (UK) PM job". Reacting to the front page of a British newspaper that said "Could Boris (Johnson) and Rishi unite to save Tories?", the billionaire suggested that only Sunak can help the Tories in the country's economic revival and political stability.

75.title: Zelenskyy urges West to warn Russia against blowing up hydro-electric dam
75.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has urged Western countries to warn Russia against blowing up Nova Kakhovka hydro-electric dam built on the Dnipro river. "Destroying the dam would mean a large-scale disaster," Zelenskyy said, calling it a new Russian terrorist attack. Russia has accused Kyiv of planning to destroy it. Neither of the countries produced any evidence supporting their claims.

76.title: 4 members of family killed in landslide in Uttarakhand's Chamoli
76.article_body: Four members of a family were killed when boulders fell on several houses after a landslide in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district at around 1 am on Saturday, said officials. The deceased included two women. According to Tharali SDM, five people were trapped under debris when the boulders fell. One of them is undergoing treatment at a hospital.

77.title: Engineer who came to cut electricity in Bihar village thrashed, video surfaces
77.article_body: Locals thrashed an engineer who had come to cut the electricity supply in Bihar's Kamtaul village. A video of the incident has surfaced online. Reports said that 10 people have been booked in the case. In the video, several people can be seen beating one man brutally while others can be seen watching.

78.title: Man arrested with 215 gm of mephedrone worth ₹43 lakh in Mumbai
78.article_body: A 37-year-old man was arrested in Mumbai's Bandra for allegedly possessing 215 grams of mephedrone worth ₹43 lakh. "He (accused) is actively involved in the supply of drugs in the city. There are 17 offences registered against his name," an official said. "He has been booked under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act," the official added.

79.title: Taylor Swift's 'Midnights' album release crashes Spotify
79.article_body: Thousands of users worldwide reported problems with accessing Spotify minutes after Taylor Swift released her 'Midnights' album on Friday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector. The issue reportedly got resolved within an hour. 'Midnights', which is the singer's 10th studio album, became the most-streamed album in a single day in Spotify's history, the music streaming platform tweeted.

80.title: Inflation not embedded in US economy: US Treasury Secretary Yellen
80.article_body: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said, "I don't believe it's (inflation) becoming embedded in the US economy". She said this when asked about the recent Consumer Price Index data showing persistent increases in non-food, non-energy core inflation factors, including rents. She also said domestic investments in semiconductors and research would help increase the country's productive capacity.

81.title: Salman Khan recovering from dengue, to take a break from Bigg Boss 16: Report
81.article_body: Actor Salman Khan was diagnosed with dengue a few days ago and is currently on a break from his work commitments, as per reports. In his absence, Bigg Boss OTT host Karan Johan took over the weekend special episode of Bigg Boss 16. Salman is reportedly recovering and will soon get back to work.

82.title: History-sheeter dies hours after being shot at close range in Thane
82.article_body: A local history-sheeter, Ganesh Jadhav, succumbed to his injuries at a hospital, hours after getting wounded in a firing incident in Thane, Maharashtra. "Around 10:30 am on Friday, some men took Jadhav to a hill in Thane city, where they demanded money from him and when he refused, they fired at him from point blank range," a police official said.

83.title: Focus is on T20 WC, not worried about what's going to happen later: Rohit on Asia Cup 2023
83.article_body: Reacting to BCCI Secretary Jay Shah's remarks that India will not travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023 and will seek a neutral venue, Team India captain Rohit Sharma said that the team is focussing on the ongoing T20 World Cup. He added, "We are not worried about what is going to happen later...BCCI will make the decisions on that."

84.title: 5th body found after Army helicopter crashes in Arunachal Pradesh
84.article_body: All five dead bodies have been recovered from the site where an Indian Army helicopter crashed in Arunachal Pradesh's Upper Siang on Friday. The Air Traffic Control had received a 'may day' call right before the crash, suggesting a technical or mechanical failure, the Army said. A court of inquiry has been constituted to investigate the causes of the accident.

85.title: New Zealand record their highest-ever total in T20 World Cup history
85.article_body: New Zealand registered a total of 200/3 against Australia in the first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Saturday. It is New Zealand's highest-ever total in T20 World Cup history. Their previous highest total in a T20 World Cup had come on June 11, 2009, when they scored 198/5	against Ireland.

86.title: Complete ban on firecrackers in Delhi hurtful to Hindus: RSS affiliate
86.article_body: The economic wing of the RSS, Swadeshi Jagran Manch (SJM), opposed the complete ban on firecrackers in Delhi during Diwali and called it hurtful to Hindus. "We should not forget that in Tamil Nadu (Sivakasi), West Bengal and several other parts of the country, the livelihoods of more than ten lakh people depend on the firecracker industry," said SJM's Co-convenor.

87.title: Sunak is the right person to be UK's next PM: Ex-Finance Min Javid
87.article_body: Former British Finance Minister Sajid Javid on Friday endorsed Indian-origin Rishi Sunak to be the next leader of the Conservative Party and the country's Prime Minister. "It is abundantly clear that...Sunak has what it takes to match the challenges we face, he is the right person to lead our party and take the country forward," Javid tweeted.

88.title: Russia delaying passage of ships carrying Ukrainian grains: Zelenskyy
88.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has accused Russia of deliberately delaying the passage of ships carrying Ukrainian grains, adding that 150 vessels were waiting to be loaded. Zelenskyy said that 3 million metric tonnes of grains, enough to feed 10 million people, were blocked. The grain export is a part of a Turkey-brokered deal signed between Russia and Ukraine.

89.title: GST Council issues guidelines on recurring show cause notices to taxpayers
89.article_body: The GST Council has issued guidelines on recurring show cause notices to taxpayers. The Council said only the so-called jurisdictional tax authorities must issue recurring show cause notices to those under investigation even if the initial one is issued by another authority, which could be central or state officials. The tax authorities have also implemented measures to ease taxpayers' burden.

90.title: New Zealand's Devon Conway smashes highest score of T20 World Cup 2022 so far
90.article_body: New Zealand opener Devon Conway on Saturday smashed the highest individual score of T20 World Cup 2022 so far. Conway scored 92*(58) against Australia in the first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match. The previous highest score of the tournament was 86(55) registered by Scotland's Michael Jones against Ireland on October 19.

91.title: 6 arrested for possessing leopard skin in Telangana's Bhupalpally
91.article_body: Six persons were arrested in Telangana's Bhupalpally for allegedly possessing leopard skin, which they were trying to sell. Two of the accused set up a trap at Pamed near the Telangana-Chhattisgarh border and killed the leopard, said police. "They were on the way to Maharashtra to sell the leopard skin for ₹30 lakh," added police.

92.title: Ghaziabad man held nearly month after he shot wife, snatched son from her
92.article_body: Ghaziabad Police have arrested a man for allegedly shooting and injuring wife and snatching their son from her nearly a month after the incident. Reports said the accused had, on September 26, gone to Ghaziabad to meet his wife and tried to take his two-year-old son. When she resisted, he allegedly shot at her and ran away with their son.

93.title: Intimate moments of couples secretly filmed in OYO rooms; 4 arrested in Noida
93.article_body: At least four people have been arrested in Noida for allegedly filming intimate moments of couples secretly in rooms of OYO hotels. The accused allegedly blackmailed the couples and threatened to leak their videos if they did not pay up, police said. They allegedly booked rooms in hotels and placed hidden cameras in the rooms before checking out, police added.

94.title: Apple will not manufacture iPhone 14 Pro Max in India: Report
94.article_body: Apple will not manufacture iPhone 14 Pro Max in India, a report said. This comes after several reports had emerged suggesting that iPhone 14 Pro Max is being manufactured in the country. Foxconn is assembling iPhone 14 at its Sriperumbudur facility near Chennai. Apple manufactures iPhone11, iPhone12 and iPhone 13 in India at the Foxconn facility.

95.title: ₹78 crore seized from 5 locations including Razorpay premises: ED
95.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has seized ₹78 crore after conducting searches at five locations including Razorpay premises in Bengaluru in Chinese loan apps case. A month ago, searches were conducted at Paytm, Razorpay and Cashfree Payments premises. "Said entities were doing their suspected/illegal business through various merchant IDs/accounts held with payment gateways/banks," agency added.

96.title: File report on commercial activities in residential areas: HC to BBMP
96.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has ordered Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) to file a comprehensive report on commercial activities being carried out in residential areas. The court has given the civic body eight weeks to do so. This comes after Wilson Garden Residents Welfare Association moved the court seeking to restrict commercial activities in their locality.

97.title: SEBI bars Bombay Dyeing, Wadias from securities market, imposes ₹13.25 crore fine
97.article_body: Markets regulator SEBI has barred Bombay Dyeing and its promoters Nusli N Wadia, Ness Wadia and Jehangir Wadia from the securities market for two years for being involved in a fraudulent scheme of misrepresenting financial statements. The regulator has imposed a total monetary penalty of ₹13.25 crore on the company and the Wadias, directing them to pay within 45 days.

98.title: Sale of European strategic infrastructures to China was an error: Macron
98.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron said the European Union has to re-think its trade dialogue with China. "We've made strategic errors in the past with the sale of infrastructures to China," Macron said at the end of a two-day EU summit on Friday. Separately, Finnish PM Sanna Marin said EU shouldn't be building strategic, critical dependency on authoritarian regimes like China.

99.title: My11Circle launches 'Har Din SUV Jito' T20 World Cup campaign
99.article_body: Fantasy cricket app My11Circle has launched 'Har Din SUV Jito' campaign featuring Saurav Ganguly. Trusted by 2.9 crore+ users, My11Circle allows users to use their cricket knowledge to create fantasy teams and win big rewards, shared the brand, adding that 100% real human players, unique app features, lower competition, and instant withdrawals make playing on My11Circle 100% safe and rewarding.

100.title: 5-year-old girl dies after over half dozen dogs attack her in MP's Khargone
100.article_body: A five-year-old girl was killed after half-a-dozen stray dogs attacked her in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone. Reports said that the girl received injuries on the neck and other parts of her body and died of excessive bleeding during treatment. The girl was going to a nearby shop to buy groceries when the incident took place.

101.title: India's forex reserves fall by $4.50 billion to $528.37 billion
101.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell by $4.50 billion to $528.37 billion for the week ending October 14, Reserve Bank of India data showed on Friday. The fall can be attributed to a decline in Foreign Currency Assets, which dropped $2.83 billion to $468.67 billion. In the previous week, the forex reserves had improved for the first time in 10 weeks.

102.title: Kidney patient waiting for dialysis dies as power goes off in UP hospital
102.article_body: A kidney patient who was waiting for his dialysis procedure died after power supply went off in a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Amroha. While the patient was waiting for power supply till 2 pm, his condition deteriorated, reports said. The water supply to the dialysis unit was also cut due to power disruption.

103.title: S Korea arrests ex-Defence Min over 2020 killing by North Ko­rea
103.article_body: South Korea's former Defence Minister and Coast Guard Commissioner were arrested on Saturday over their alleged involvement in a cover-up related to North Korea's killing of a South Korean fisheries official in 2020. Arrest warrants were issued for ex-Defence Minister Suh Wook and ex-Coast Guard chief Kim Hong-hee over the risks of the suspects fleeing or destroying evidence.

104.title: Rajasthan revises pay scale of 31,473 contractual workers, gram panchayat assistants
104.article_body: Rajasthan government has revised the pay scale of around 31,473 contractual workers, gram panchayat assistants, education workers and para teachers, state Education Minister BD Kalla said. "They will now get a salary of ₹18,500 after nine years of service and ₹32,000 after 18 years of service," Kalla tweeted. Congress leader Harish Chaudhary called the revision a 'Diwali gift' for people.

105.title: Raju Srivastava's wife posts unseen video of him singing Kishore Kumar song, pens note
105.article_body: Raju Srivastava's wife Shikha has shared an unseen video of the late comedian singing Kishore Kumar's 'Yaadon Main Woh Sapnon Main Hai' song. "It's been a month since you're gone but we know you're still with us and will continue to be...I didn't know you would change this song into reality so soon (in just 12 days)," she wrote.

106.title: Delhi Metro's last trains on Diwali to start at 10 pm on all lines: DMRC
106.article_body: The last train on all lines of Delhi Metro will start at 10 pm on Diwali, Delhi Metro Rail Corporation Limited (DMRC) said. "On account of Diwali, the last Metro train service on Monday will start at 10:00 pm from terminal stations of all lines," it tweeted. "Metro trains will run as usual for rest of the day," DMRC added.

107.title: RBI allows Tamilnad Mercantile Bank to open new branches after 3 yrs
107.article_body: The RBI has lifted a three-year ban on Tamilnad Mercantile Bank's branch opening with effect from October 21, the lender said on Friday. This development comes after the Thoothukudi-based bank's shares were listed on the stock exchanges on September 15. Currently, it has 509 branches, of which 106 are rural, 247 are semi-urban, 80 are urban and 76 are metropolitan.

108.title: Replace Gandhi pic with Netaji's on currency notes: Hindu Mahasabha
108.article_body: Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha (ABHM) has demanded Mahatma Gandhi's photo from currency notes to be replaced with that of Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose. ABHM's Chandrachur Goswami said that it is the "best way to honour India's greatest freedom fighter Netaji". "We think Netaji's contribution to the country's freedom struggle was no less than that of Mahatma Gandhi," he added.

109.title: Extreme evil: French Prez after 12-yr-old girl murdered, body found in suitcase
109.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron called the murder of a 12-year-old girl, whose body was found in a suitcase outside her Paris home last week, an act of "extreme evil". Macron said the family of the girl, Lola, needed "the respect and affection of the nation". A 24-year-old woman has been arrested on suspicion of murder, rape and acts of torture.

110.title: Planning to open medical college, hospital in each district: Bihar CM
110.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar announced that the government is planning to open at least one medical college and hospital in each district. He also distributed appointment letters to 9,469 health employees in Patna. "The state health society will make another 11,000 new appointments in the coming years…More than 37,400 people have been appointed in the last five years," said Kumar.

111.title: NZ break record for scoring most runs in 1st over vs Australia in T20 WC history
111.article_body: New Zealand on Saturday broke the record for scoring most runs in the first over against Australia in T20 World Cup history. New Zealand scored 14 runs off the first over in the first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match against Australia. The over was bowled by Mitchell Starc, while New Zealand's Finn Allen aggregated all the runs.

112.title: Air India appoints Henry Donohoe as safety, security head
112.article_body: Air India has appointed Henry Donohoe as the head of its safety, security and quality functions with effect from November 7. Donohoe, an Irish national, started his career at Aer Lingus in 1978 and became its Chief Pilot. He then headed key departments including safety, quality, flight operations and engineering. He was also associated with Emirates for seven years.

113.title: MCG fines 9 people for illegally dumping garbage, 7 vehicles seized
113.article_body: To tackle the air pollution menace, the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) increased mechanical sweeping and sprinkling of recycled water on roads and at places where construction is underway. An MCG spokesperson said that fines were issued to nine people for keeping construction material uncovered and dumping garbage illegally. The body also seized seven vehicles for carrying mixed garbage.

114.title: Deutsche Bank cuts dozens of investment banking jobs globally: Report
114.article_body: Deutsche Bank has fired dozens of employees in investment banking division globally, Bloomberg reported. The job cuts were implemented across all levels, with focus on junior ranks. The step reportedly comes in line with efforts to keep costs low. Deutsche Bank fired more than 20 junior bank employees and some senior officials based in New York, New York Post reported.

115.title: No idea why people are bashing my wife: Hetmyer who was dropped from WC over missed flight
115.article_body: After West Indies crashed out of T20 World Cup 2022, batter Shimron Hetmyer, who was dropped from the squad over missed flight, wrote on his Instagram Stories, "I have no idea why people are bashing my wife about everything that I do." He added, "I do have a mind of my own and make my own decisions and choices."

116.title: Ex-Chinese Prez sitting next to Xi escorted out of meeting; video shows him confused
116.article_body: Former Chinese President Hu Jintao, the immediate predecessor of Xi Jinping, on Saturday was unexpectedly escorted out of the closing ceremony of a congress of the ruling Communist Party. The 79-year-old, who was seated next to Xi, was led off the stage by two men. The video of the incident shows Hu appearing to be confused while being escorted out.

117.title: PM Modi launches 'Rozgar Mela'; 75,000 youths get appointment letters
117.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday launched 'Rozgar Mela', the recruitment drive for 10 lakh youths, via video conferencing. Appointment letters to more than 75,000 youths were handed over during the ceremony. "As per the PM's directions, all ministries and departments are working towards filling up existing vacancies against sanctioned posts in 'mission mode'," the official press release said.

118.title: Side effects of biggest crisis in 100 years can't just go away in 100 days: PM Modi
118.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said, "The side effects of the biggest crisis in 100 years can't just go away in 100 days." Addressing the 'Rozgar Mela', he noted that many big economies of the world are struggling with inflation and unemployment. "Despite this, India has been trying to save itself from global crisis by taking new initiatives and risks," he added.

119.title: Software engineer out on bike ride gang-raped by 10 in Jharkhand; boyfriend beaten
119.article_body: A 26-year-old software engineer was allegedly gang-raped by around 10 men in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum district, police said. The woman was out with her boyfriend on a bike on Thursday when the incident took place. The men thrashed her boyfriend and allegedly gang-raped her after taking her to a secluded area, police told PTI.

120.title: Elephant electrocuted to death in Assam, toll rises
120.article_body: An elephant was electrocuted to death after coming in contact with a live electric wire near the Napuk tea estate in the Charaideo district of Assam on Friday, said forest officials. Multiple elephant deaths have been reported in the state over the last few weeks. Earlier this month, an elephant died from electrocution in the Kokrajhar district.

121.title: Donald Trump summoned to testify before panel probing US Capitol riots
121.article_body: The House Select Committee investigating the US Capitol riots has summoned former US President Donald Trump, ordering him to testify under oath. Trump has been asked to produce documents detailing his communications before the riots. "We have assembled overwhelming evidence...that you personally orchestrated and oversaw...effort to overturn the 2020 presidential election," Committee told Trump.

122.title: 12-yr-old boy out to get chapatis for dad killed as BEST bus crushes him
122.article_body: A 12-year-old boy was killed after a Brihanmumbai Electric Supply & Transport Undertaking bus crushed him in Mumbai. Reports said that the boy was out to buy chapatis from a nearby hotel for his father when the incident took place. Reports added that the driver could not stop the vehicle in time and crushed the boy.

123.title: PM Modi announces ₹2 lakh ex-gratia for families of deceased in Rewa accident
123.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakhs from Prime Minister's National Relief Fund (PMNRF) for the families of those who were killed in the bus accident in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa. PMO said that those injured in the accident would be given ₹50,000. As many as 15 people were killed in the incident while 40 others were injured.

124.title: US woman stabbed & buried alive by ex-husband, survives by using nose to remove soil
124.article_body: A 42-year-old woman who was allegedly stabbed and buried alive by former husband in US' Washington managed to survive by wiggling her nose in the soil to create pockets of space that allowed her to breathe, she said. The man has been arrested and charged with attempted murder, domestic violence/first-degree assault and kidnapping. The woman was rushed to a hospital.

125.title: ₹1,457 crore paid by Google India to its Ireland arm is not royalty, rules ITAT
125.article_body: The Bengaluru-bench of Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) ruled that payments totalling ₹1,457 crore made by Google India to Google Ireland is not a royalty and therefore, it is not subject to withholding tax. In its earlier order, the ITAT held that payments made by Google India between 2007-08 and 2012-13 are royalty and tax should be paid in India.

126.title: Facebook threatens to stop news sharing in Canada over revenue-sharing bill
126.article_body: Facebook has warned that it may block news sharing on its platform in Canada at a time when a legislation that compels digital platforms to pay news publishers for their content is under consideration. "The Online News Act misrepresents the relationship between platforms and news publishers," a Meta Canada official said. Facebook has not been invited to share its concerns.

127.title: Myanmar put on terror financing watchdog FATF's 'black list'
127.article_body: Global money laundering and terror financing watchdog Financial Action Task Force (FATF) has 'blacklisted' Myanmar for "continued lack of progress" by the military junta. The watchdog also called on member countries to apply enhanced due diligence to business relations and transactions in Myanmar. The FATF "black list" consists of just two other countries, Iran and North Korea.

128.title: Jio's Q2 net profit rises by 28% to ₹4,518 cr, revenue up 20%
128.article_body: Reliance Jio posted a 28% rise in net profit to ₹4,518 crore during the September quarter and on a sequential basis, the profit grew by 4%. Its revenue was reported at ₹22,521 crore, a 20% year-on-year increase. Sequentially, revenue increased by 3%. The average revenue per user (ARPU) at ₹177.2 per subscriber per month witnessed a 23.5% growth.

129.title: I am not playing WC, team has already left: Dhoni on cricket-related question at an event
129.article_body: A video has gone viral showing an interaction between an anchor and former India captain MS Dhoni at an event. The anchor can be heard saying, "If I don't ask you a World Cup question, [the audience] are gonna lynch me", to which Dhoni responds, "I'm not playing the World Cup...The team has already left."

130.title: Langur attends funeral of man who used to feed it, tries to wake him up; video viral
130.article_body: A video showing a langur attending the funeral of a man who used to feed it has gone viral on social media. In the video, the langur can be seen sitting near the body of the man and trying to wake him up. Several users who shared the clip said it has been shot in Sri Lanka's Batticaloa.

131.title: Vodafone Idea to issue ₹1,600 cr debentures to ATC Telecom to repay dues
131.article_body: The cash-strapped Vodafone Idea's (Vi) board on Friday approved the issuance of debentures worth ₹1,600 crore to ATC Telecom Infrastructure Private Limited. The telco will use the funds to repay dues to ATC Telecom, which stand at less than ₹2,000 crore. Vi said any funds remaining will be used for the company's "general corporate purposes".

132.title: Fire breaks out during refilling petroleum depot in Bhopal, 7 injured
132.article_body: A massive fire broke out during refilling at a petroleum depot in the Bakaniya area in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, police said. As many as seven people were injured in the incident, police added. "All the injured persons have been admitted to a nearby private hospital," DCP Bhopal Vijay Khatri said. "Of those injured, four are in critical condition," Khatri added.

133.title: Airtel announces the launch of Airtel 5G Plus
133.article_body: Airtel has launched Airtel 5G Plus in a phased manner in Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Siliguri, Nagpur and Varanasi. It shared that customers can check if their area/ smartphone is 5G-enabled via Airtel Thanks App, adding that Airtel customers can switch to Airtel 5G Plus on their existing Airtel 4G SIMs.

134.title: Chemist, electrician returning from Chandigarh shop die as SUV hits scooter
134.article_body: A 35-year-old chemist, Suresh Kumar, and a 50-year-old electrician, Mahesh Chand, were killed after an SUV hit the scooter that they were travelling on in Chandigarh. The driver of the SUV has been arrested. The deceased were returning from Suresh's shop. Reports quoted sources as saying that the driver of the SUV was drunk.

135.title: AIMIM organises biryani fests in Madhya Pradesh to strengthen party
135.article_body: Ahead of the Madhya Pradesh Assembly elections in 2023, AIMIM launched its campaign by organising biryani fests to strengthen the party in the state. "Our [plan] is to make more than 10 lakh members of AIMIM before the Assembly elections. People are coming to Owaisi with enthusiasm...Hyderabadi Biryani is very famous after Owaisi in India," said AIMIM leader Peerzada Nizami.

136.title: Indian-origin man charged for killing his 11-yr-old son, 13-yr-old daughter in Canada
136.article_body: A 45-year-old Indian-origin Canadian man, Kamaljit Arora, has been charged with two counts of first-degree murder after his 11-year-old son and 13-year-old daughter were killed in their home in Montreal. He's also charged with one count of assault causing bodily harm for allegedly strangling his wife. Their neighbour said that the kids' elder sister had notified the police.

137.title: Viraj Ghelani orders pataka online, ends up getting Pataka Wraps: Faasos
137.article_body: Faasos shared that this Diwali, patakas aren't the only thing trending as its quirky activation idea got the netizens talking about its #PatakaWraps: Diwali-special wrap collection. Instagrammers like Viraj Ghelani, Nayandeep Rakshit posted about how their pataka order turned out to be exclusive bomb-tasting wraps, Faasos said, adding that the collection features some of its most loved wraps.

138.title: Delhi valet parking worker says i20 ran over feet, policeman's daughter booked
138.article_body: The Delhi Assistant Commissioner of Police's daughter has been booked after a valet parking assistant said that she ran over his feet with a car at a mall in Saket. "An i20...ran over my feet. My colleagues rushed me to hospital...I did not file the complaint earlier as I was waiting for my family members," victim said in an FIR.

139.title: MobiKwik's loss widens to ₹128 cr in FY22, revenue up 82%: Report
139.article_body: MobiKwik's parent company One MobiKwik Systems' consolidated revenue jumped 82.5% to ₹526.5 crore, while its consolidated loss was ₹128 crore in FY22 as compared to ₹111 crore a year ago, Moneycontrol reported citing regulatory filings. Total income jumped 80% to ₹543 crore and total expenses increased 61% to ₹652.5 crore. MobiKwik attained unicorn status in October 2021.

140.title: 'Red light on, Gaadi off' campaign from Oct 28 as Delhi AQI worsens
140.article_body: In a bid to curb vehicular pollution, the Delhi government will start its 'Red Light on, Gaadi off' campaign from October 28, said Environment Minister Gopal Rai. The city's Air Quality Index (AQI) on Friday plunged to 262, which falls in the 'poor' category. Experts believe toxic smog levels could increase after Diwali if the wind direction changes, added Rai.

141.title: UK Defence Secy opts out of PM race, suggests he would back Johnson
141.article_body: British Defence Secretary Ben Wallace on Friday said he would not stand in the contest to replace Liz Truss as Prime Minister. "I feel that I can add the best value in keeping people safe at defence, by being the Defence Secretary," he added. Wallace also said he is "leaning towards" backing ex-PM Boris Johnson in the Tory leadership race.

142.title: Bengal teen kills self in police station after boy refuses to marry
142.article_body: An 18-year-old woman allegedly killed herself in the toilet of a police station in West Bengal's Uttar Dinajpur after a 17-year-old boy refused to marry her. "The two were reportedly in a relationship for six months," said an officer. The incident occurred after the woman created a ruckus outside the boy's house on Thursday. The boy was taken into custody.

143.title: No fine for violating traffic rules in Gujarat till Oct 27; violators to get flowers
143.article_body: Gujarat Home Minister Harsh Sanghavi has announced that no fine will be levied for traffic rule violations in the state from October 21 to 27 due to the festival of Diwali. "Don't use the decision to break the law. If someone breaks the rules, the Gujarat Police will persuade them not to, by giving flowers," he said in a video.

144.title: Woman claims L'Oreal hair products caused cancer, sues company in US
144.article_body: A woman in US has sued L'Oreal after claiming that she contracted uterine cancer after using chemical hair straightening products sold by L'Oreal USA. She said she had used the products for over two decades before being diagnosed and undergoing a full hysterectomy. This comes after a study established a link between usage of hair straightening products and uterine cancer.

145.title: SBI hikes interest rates on select fixed deposits by up to 80 bps
145.article_body: State Bank of India (SBI) hiked interest rates on select fixed deposit (FD) tenures by up to 80 basis points. The new rates, which come into effect from October 22, will be applicable for FDs of less than ₹2 crore. The announcement comes days after SBI hiked the savings deposit rates by 30 bps for large accounts on October 18.

146.title: ﻿Synapsica﻿ fires 30% staff a month after CEO, COO arrested in ₹16-cr fraud case
146.article_body: Synapsica, a healthtech startup backed by Y Combinator, has laid off nearly 30% of its employees as part of a restructuring move, Co-founder Kuldeep Singh Chauhan confirmed. The layoffs come a month after the arrests of the company's CEO Meenakshi Singh and COO Dr Cherian. The siblings were arrested for allegedly duping Synapsica Co-founder Gandharv Goyal of around ₹16 crore.

147.title: US protects Ethiopian immigrants from deportation amid civil war
147.article_body: Citing the civil war in Ethiopia, the US on Friday announced that Ethiopians living in the country will get work permits and be shielded from deportation for 18 months. US Homeland Security Department said it was extending Temporary Protected Status to Ethiopians due to the "extraordinary and temporary conditions" that make it dangerous for them to return to their country.

148.title: 10 held for selling fake platelets as man dies after wrong platelets transfusion in UP
148.article_body: Ten gang members were arrested for allegedly selling fake platelets to patients in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. Police said the accused used to take plasma from different blood banks and put it in pouches. The action came after a man died after wrong platelets transfusion on October 17. His family claimed that the platelet was thin and made of mosambi juice.

149.title: Central Railway hikes platform ticket fare to ₹50 till Oct-end in Mumbai
149.article_body: Central Railway of Mumbai Division increased the price of platform tickets from ₹10 to ₹50 from Friday till October-end. The increased fare will be enforced only at Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus, Dadar, Thane, Kalyan, Lokmanya Tilak Terminus and Panvel stations, an official said. The decision was taken to curb the excessive rush of passengers amid the festive Diwali season.

150.title: India reports 2,112 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 24,043
150.article_body: India reported 2,112 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,119 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 24,043. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,957 following four casualties in the last 24 hours.

151.title: Noida Police arrests 2 for extortion by filming couple's hotel stay
151.article_body: Two persons have been arrested for trying to extort money from a couple by recording videos of their stay at a hotel, said Noida Police. According to police, the accused stayed in the same hotel room a few days ago and installed a camera there. The police said the couple received their videos and were asked to pay money.

152.title: MCD allocates ₹40,000 per ward to increase street lights at Chhath ghats
152.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) has allocated ₹40,000 per ward to increase street lighting facilities at around 500 Chhath ghats in the national capital. "The funds will be provided for two ghats per ward. The amount will be utilised for strengthening street lighting in and around Chhath Puja ghats," a corporation spokesperson said.

153.title: Advisory issued against scammers and 5G fraud in Maharashtra
153.article_body: The Maharashtra Police have recently issued an advisory against a new wave of scammers and they believe that the fraudsters might try to cheat citizens on the pretext of providing 5G services. "Citizens are being warned not to fall prey to such calls and messages and we appeal to them not to share their details," said the advisory.

154.title: Viral video shows groom wearing gigantic garland of notes in Pak; people call him 'UFO'
154.article_body: A video showing a groom wearing a gigantic garland of currency notes in Pakistan has gone viral on social media. Reacting to the video, social media users wrote, "He looks like UFO," and, "This looks like a bed cover." Many users called it a "show off", with one saying, "I'd rather have it in an envelope."

155.title: 2 arrested for attacking Hyd petrol pump, scaring staff with toy gun
155.article_body: Two persons have been arrested for allegedly attacking a petrol pump in Hyderabad on October 17. The accused reportedly used a toy gun and a knife to scare the staff and broke the window and furniture of the petrol pump's office. They are also said to have hurt the employees and the owner of the petrol pump.

156.title: Mumbai twins cured of thalassemia as 9-yr-old brother donates bone marrow
156.article_body: Swarali and Swaranjali, 12-year-old twin sisters, who were suffering from thalassemia, have been cured of the blood disorder after their nine-year-old brother, Raj Jadhav, donated his bone marrow for their treatment. "I...told him it would be very painful. It took us six months to arrange funds for the transplants and prepare him mentally," said their father.

157.title: White House in talks with Musk to set up Starlink in Iran: Report
157.article_body: The White House is in talks with SpaceX CEO Elon Musk about setting up his company's satellite internet service Starlink in Iran, CNN reported citing multiple officials. Iran imposed internet restrictions after death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini in police custody last month sparked nationwide protests. The US Treasury Department earlier eased some sanctions to help Iranians access internet.

158.title: Reliance to demerge financial services business, list it on stock exchanges
158.article_body: Reliance Industries has announced the demerger of its financial services business into a separate entity and the subsequent listing of the same on stock exchanges. The Mukesh Ambani-led company will demerge Reliance Strategic Investments and the resulting entity will be named Jio Financial Services. This will be done through a share-swap arrangement and no cash will be involved, Reliance said.

159.title: Apple's top hardware designer to leave 3 years after replacing Jony Ive
159.article_body: Apple's VP of industrial design Evans Hankey will leave the company after being in the role for three years. She took over the role in 2019 after the departure of Jony Ive, Apple's former design chief who worked with the company for two decades. Hankey will reportedly remain at Apple for the next six months to help with the transition.

160.title: Notice sent to medical college after video of girl dancing & rapping goes viral in Pakistan
160.article_body: A notice was issued to a medical college in Pakistan's Peshawar after a video of a girl rapping and dancing on stage during an event went viral on social media. The letter called the incident "unethical and immoral". "You are therefore directed to explain your position within three days positively, otherwise strict disciplinary action will be initiated," the letter stated.

161.title: Moody's lowers UK's outlook to 'negative' over political turmoil
161.article_body: Rating agency Moody's, on Friday, lowered the UK's outlook to 'negative' from 'stable' over the ongoing political turmoil following PM Liz Truss' resignation on Thursday. Moody's maintained its sovereign rating at 'Aa3' and said there was "heightened unpredictability in policymaking amid weaker growth prospects and high inflation". It also said there were "risks to the UK's debt affordability".

162.title: Russia not interested in ending Ukraine aggression: US
162.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken said there is no evidence at the moment that Russia is "actually interested in stopping the [Ukraine] aggression". "On the contrary, we see Russia...tripling down on its aggression: in the last month, the mobilisation of hundreds of thousands of Russians; horrifically, cannon fodder that [Vladimir] Putin is trying to throw into the war," he added.

163.title: PCMC stays move over waste collection from big societies from Nov 1
163.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) on Friday stayed its decision not to collect wet waste from big housing societies from November 1. "At the same time, we will continue to hold positive engagement to convince them about processing the wet waste at their premises under the Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016," Municipal Commissioner Shekhar Singh said.

164.title: Delhi Police arrests 2 absconders evading arrest for 24 years from Bihar
164.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two men who had been evading arrest for 24 years in connection with a murder case from Bihar. "Our team...was regularly working to nab these proclaimed offenders. On Thursday, secret input was received about them," DCP (South) Chandan Choudhary said. One of the accused was absconding after his release on court bail in 1999.

165.title: Mumbai woman looking to buy appliances via Facebook ad cheated of ₹2.07 lakh
165.article_body: A 30-year-old woman was cheated of ₹2.07 lakh after being promised air conditioner and washing machine through Facebook advertisement. The man, who claimed to be a Navy official said he would sell the appliances to her for ₹15,000. However, three men cheated her of ₹2.07 lakh under pretext of failed transactions. She was even asked for money for airport clearance.

166.title: 12 flyers injured, suffer broken nose as turbulence hits Spain flight; pic surfaces
166.article_body: Twelve passengers were injured after an Aerolíneas Argentinas flight from Spain to Argentina carrying 271 people was hit by severe turbulence, the airline said. A passenger is said to have suffered a broken nose, while a picture showed a passenger on a wheelchair with head injury. The airline said that three passengers were moved to a hospital.

167.title: ED seizes ₹78 crore during raids in B'luru in Chinese loan apps case
167.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate conducted raids at five locations in Bengaluru in the Chinese loan apps case and seized ₹78 crore. It also searched premises of payment gateway Razorpay, a spokesperson of which said the company cooperated with the agency and its funds were not seized. These apps are operated by Chinese nationals using forged documents of Indians, said the ED.

168.title: Rishi Sunak qualifies for UK PM race, 1st to get support of over 100 MPs
168.article_body: British Conservative politician Rishi Sunak has reached the minimum nomination threshold to enter the race to be the next party leader and Prime Minister. The ex-Finance Minister is the first contender to receive support of at least 100 Tory MPs. Sunak will automatically become party leader and Prime Minister if others fail to win 100 nominations from fellow Tory MPs.

169.title: Hyderabad Metro bans travelling with firecrackers ahead of Diwali
169.article_body: Hyderabad Metro Rail Limited (HMRL) has prohibited its passengers from travelling with firecrackers ahead of Diwali. It has put up posters at various stations for it. According to officials, carrying such objects could endanger the safety of everyone using the metro system, including the staff and the public. Violators won't be allowed to ride the train, said officials.

170.title: India reacts after Pakistan removed from terror financing watchdog's grey list
170.article_body: After Pakistan was removed from global terror finance watchdog FATF's grey list, India said, "As a result of FATF scrutiny, Pakistan has been forced to take some action against well-known terrorists." "It is in global interest that the world remains clear that Pakistan must continue to take credible, verifiable, irreversible and sustained action against terrorism," India further said.

171.title: When and at what time will India's T20 World Cup 2022 matches take place?
171.article_body: India will face Pakistan in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match on October 23. India will face Netherlands, South Africa, Bangladesh and Zimbabwe on October 27, 30, November 2 and 6, respectively. India's matches against Pakistan, Bangladesh and Zimbabwe will begin at 1.30 pm. India's matches against Netherlands and SA will begin at 12.30 pm and 4.30 pm, respectively.

172.title: 14 killed, 40 injured as bus travelling from Hyd to UP collides with trolley in MP
172.article_body: As many as 14 persons were killed and 40 others were injured in a collision between a bus and trolley near Suhagi Pahari in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa, police said. "Of the 40 injured, 20 (have been) admitted to a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj," Rewa SP Navneet Bhasin said. "Bus was going from Hyderabad to Gorakhpur," Bhasin added.

173.title: JugJugg Jeeyo premieres tonight, 8 pm on Colors Cineplex
173.article_body: JugJugg Jeeyo, one of the year's most successful movies as per Bollywood Hungama, will have its world television premiere on Colors Cineplex. The movie boasts a stellar star cast including Anil Kapoor, Neetu Kapoor, Varun Dhawan, Kiara Advani, Prajakta Koli, and Maniesh Paul who come together to make your Diwali more 'lit' on Colors Cineplex, said the brand.

174.title: Viraj Ghelani orders pataka online, ends up getting Pataka Wraps: Faasos
