The man is a retired Lok Sabha staffer. "The complainant had managed to recover over ₹30 lakh by writing to firms where his money had been invested with forged documents," a police officer said.

348.title: Russian court orders arrest of journalist who protested war on live TV
348.article_body: A Russian court has ordered the arrest of journalist Marina Ovsyannikova, who protested against the Russian invasion of Ukraine during an on-air news bulletin, Interfax reported. Ovsyannikova's lawyer earlier said that she fled Russia after refusing to be under house arrest. The journalist was accused of spreading fake news about Russian armed forces during one-person protest near the Kremlin.

349.title: PM Modi lays foundation stone of connectivity projects worth ₹3,400 cr in Uttarakhand
349.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday laid the foundation stone of various connectivity projects worth over ₹3,400 crore at Mana village in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district. The projects unveiled by the PM include two new ropeway projects connecting Gaurikund to Kedarnath and Govindghat to Hemkund Sahib. "For me, every village on the border is the first village in India," PM added.

350.title: SC dismisses plea seeking opening of 22 rooms of Taj Mahal
350.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday dismissed a plea seeking the "opening of 22 rooms" on the premises of the Taj Mahal and a "fact-finding inquiry" into the monument's history. The petition was earlier dismissed by Allahabad High Court. "The high court was not in error in dismissing the petition, which is more of a publicity interest litigation," the SC said.

351.title: 3-year-old shoots and kills 15-month-old baby in US; probe on
351.article_body: A 15-month-old baby has died after being shot in the face by a three-year-old in the US state of Pennsylvania on Tuesday. The victim's grandfather told local media that the three-year-old was a relative. The Lancaster Bureau of Police is investigating the incident and said that adults were being questioned. No arrests have been made so far.

352.title: Missing food delivery executive found dead in nullah in Pune
352.article_body: A food delivery executive who went missing on October 17 was found dead on Friday in a nullah in Pune, police said. The deceased's brother claimed that it was raining heavily when his brother went to deliver food and added, "We suspect he might've got washed away in...rainwater." A probe is on to ascertain cause of death, an inspector said.

353.title: Girl gets paper re-checked, beats twin sister to become Class 12 UP board exam topper
353.article_body: Divya from Fatehpur district has become the new topper of Class 12 Uttar Pradesh board exam, taking away the top spot from her twin sister Divyanshi who scored 477/500. Divya, who scored 56 marks in Hindi, had applied for re-evaluation of the paper, following which the marks rose to 94, District Inspector of Schools said. Divya has scored 479/500.

354.title: ED seizes jewellery worth ₹149 cr during raids in Hyderabad, Vijayawada
354.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) said it has seized jewellery stocks worth more than ₹149 crore during recent raids at five locations in Hyderabad and Vijayawada. The raids were conducted in a case related to alleged cheating with MMTC, a public sector enterprise. The search operations were conducted at MBS Jewellers Pvt Ltd and Musaddilal Gems and Jewels India Pvt Ltd.

355.title: List of 10 all time best Indian films released
355.article_body: The India chapter of the International Federation of Film Critics (FIPRESCI) has released a list of the top 10 films in the history of Indian cinema. Satyajit Ray's Pather Panchali topped the list followed by 1960 drama Meghe Dhaka Tara, Bhuvan Shome (1969), Malayalam film Elippathayam (1981), Ghatashraddha (1977) and Garm Hava (1973). Sholay has been ranked 10th by FIPRESCI.

356.title: Fraudster arrested for cheating Mumbai investor of ₹12 lakh
356.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a 38-year-old fraudster from Tamil Nadu for allegedly cheating a man of ₹12 lakh on the pretext of high returns on diamond trading investment. The police has seized at least five crypto wallets in which cryptocurrency worth lakhs of rupees was kept. It has also confiscated 119 mobile phones used by the accused.

357.title: At least 150 people killed in 2 days of fighting in Sudan
357.article_body: At least 150 people have reportedly been killed in ethnic clashes in the last two days in Sudan's Blue Nile state. The violence broke out last week between rival ethnic groups following a land dispute in which more than a dozen people were killed. Sudan has been grappling with political unrest and violence since last year's military coup.

358.title: Priyanka Gandhi to hold 8 rallies, roadshows in Himachal Pradesh
358.article_body: Ahead of the Himachal Pradesh polls, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi will hold eight rallies and roadshows in the state until November 10. She will start her campaign from Mandi and Kullu on October 31 before visiting Kangra and Chamba on November 3. The state will go to polls on November 12 and the votes will be counted on December 8.

359.title: Youths who pelted stones in J&K now becoming sarpanches: Amit Shah
359.article_body: On the occasion of Police Commemoration Day, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that youths who pelted stones in Jammu and Kashmir are now becoming panches and sarpanches. "Earlier, armed forces were given special power, now youth is given special power for their progress," he added. Most hotspots in the country are "almost free" from anti-national activities, he further said.

360.title: Sachin Tendulkar forays into NFTs as a strategic investor in Rario
360.article_body: Rario, a licensed digital cricket collectibles platform, announced that Sachin Tendulkar has invested in and partnered with the company for his exclusive NFTs/digital collectibles. Rario stated that it has already exclusively partnered with Aaron Finch, Quinton de Kock, Shakib Al Hasan, Rishabh Pant, Virender Sehwag, Zaheer Khan, Smriti Mandhana, Cricket Australia, New Zealand Cricket among others.

361.title: Muslims can never trust people who worship Godse: SP MLA Mehmood
361.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA Iqbal Mehmood on Thursday claimed that Muslims can never vote for BJP as they can "never trust people who worship Godse, the killer of Mahatma Gandhi". He also alleged that the AIMIM, which is led by Asaduddin Owaisi, is BJP's "B team". "A true Muslim can never vote for BJP," he further said.

362.title: Video shows bus on fire in Andhra; passengers lose cash, jewellery
362.article_body: A bus carrying about 60 passengers was gutted in fire in Andhra Pradesh on Friday, a video of which has surfaced. No passengers were hurt in the incident, however, many lost their belongings, including cash, gold jewellery and other valuables. The fire reportedly started in the engine. The driver noticed the smoke and evacuated the bus before it was engulfed.

363.title: Virat Kohli asks fans to not speak while he is practising, video goes viral
363.article_body: A video went viral showing Virat Kohli telling fans not to speak while he was practising in the nets. In the video, a fan can be heard shouting "Out of the stadium" after Kohli hit a ball. After that, Kohli said, "Please don't speak while I'm practising...It's very distracting." The fans can then be heard telling Kohli they won't speak.

364.title: Diwali to be a public school holiday in New York City schools from 2023
364.article_body: Diwali will be a public school holiday in New York City starting next year. Mayor Eric Adams announced plans to include the holiday in the public school schedule on Thursday. "We're going to have children start talking about what it is to celebrate the Festival of Lights, and how do you turn a light on within yourself," Adams said.

365.title: World War 3 very unlikely, it's the closest we have been since 1962: Elon Musk
365.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk said the World War 3 is "still very unlikely" to happen. In response to a Twitter user's query on the likelihood of a world war, Musk wrote that this is the closest the world has been since 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis. "It...would be nice to have one year without a horrible global event," he added.

366.title: Policeman steals gold ornaments from friend's house in Kerala
366.article_body: A policeman has been arrested for allegedly stealing eight sovereigns of gold ornaments from his friend's house in Kerala's Ernakulam district. The police suspect that online rummy gaming led the accused, 35-year-old Amal Dev, to indulge in theft. "He was a regular visitor to his friend's house...The investigation on the visitors of the house led to him," said police.

367.title: 2-time champions West Indies crash out of T20 World Cup 2022
367.article_body: Two-time champions West Indies crashed out of T20 World Cup 2022 after losing their Group B first round match against Ireland on Friday. Ireland restricted West Indies to 146/5 in 20 overs before chasing down the target in 17.3 overs. Ireland have qualified for the Super 12 stage by winning two out of three matches in the first round.

368.title: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who assaulted Noida woman, garlanded after release
368.article_body: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who was arrested for assaulting a woman in Noida, was garlanded after his release from jail. A video surfaced online in which his supporters can be seen showering flowers on him and shouting "Shrikant bhaiya zindabad". "One of our sisters was put forward...attempt was made to finish me politically by staging a dispute between us," Tyagi said.

369.title: Govt eyeing $7.7 billion valuation for IDBI Bank stake sale: Report
369.article_body: The government is pushing for a valuation of nearly $7.7 billion for IDBI Bank, which could be the biggest sale of the government's stake in a lender in decades, Bloomberg quoted a source as saying. The regulatory approvals and security clearances could be reportedly given to bidders after November. IDBI Bank's market value was about $5.8 billion as of Thursday.

370.title: Musk & Twitter's advisers prepare to close deal by Oct end: Report
370.article_body: Elon Musk and Twitter's advisers are preparing paperwork to complete the $44 billion takeover deal by October 28, Bloomberg reported. Talks between SpaceX CEO and the social media platform have reportedly turned cordial after months of accusations, with focus on closing the transaction. The Wall Street banks are working on steps to finalise funding about $13 billion of debt commitments.

371.title: Putin critic Navalny says he faces new criminal case, up to 30 yrs in jail
371.article_body: Jailed Russian opposition politician Alexey Navalny on Thursday said that Russian authorities have opened a new criminal case against him for "promoting terrorism and extremism" that could potentially more than double his current prison sentence. The 46-year-old critic of Russian President Vladimir Putin is currently serving more than 11 years for fraud, contempt of court and parole violations.

372.title: Army helicopter crashes in Arunachal Pradesh
372.article_body: An Army helicopter crashed in Arunachal Pradesh on Friday, according to reports. The site of accident is not connected by road and a rescue team has been sent, Defence PRO, Guwahati, said. Earlier this month, a MiG-29K fighter aircraft crashed during a routine sortie over sea off Goa coast after it developed a technical malfunction while returning to base.

373.title: Why has Google been fined ₹1,337.76 crore by the CCI?
373.article_body: The CCI has imposed ₹1,337.76 crore fine on Google for abusing its dominant position in multiple markets in Android mobile device ecosystem. Google imposes "unfair condition" on device makers by requiring them to preinstall its apps, the CCI said. It added that Google abused its dominant position in search, app stores, web browsers and video services to squeeze out competitors.

374.title: Google sued by Texas for allegedly collecting biometric data without consent
374.article_body: US state of Texas has filed a lawsuit against Google for allegedly collecting biometric data of millions of Texans, since 2015, without prior consent. Google used people's faces and voices through Google Photos, Google Assistant, and Nest Hub Max, the complaint said. Google said it will fight the case, adding that users had option to turn off biometric collection feature.

375.title: Girl allegedly gets poked in an eye with pencil at Punjab school, loses sight
375.article_body: A six-year-old girl's parents staged a protest outside a school in Punjab's Ludhiana after a classmate allegedly poked her in the eye with a pencil causing her to lose sight in one eye. The parents claimed that the school misled them about the cause of the injury and sent their daughter home instead of rushing her to a hospital.

376.title: Shah pays tribute at police memorial, says their sacrifice will be remembered
376.article_body: On the occasion of Police Commemoration Day, Union Home Minister Amit Shah paid tribute to police personnel, who lost their lives in the line of duty, at the National Police Memorial. He said that their sacrifice would always be remembered. The day is observed every year in memory of the 10 policemen killed by Chinese troops in 1959.

377.title: Delhivery's stock hits record low after falling below IPO price
377.article_body: Shares of logistics company Delhivery fell by nearly 18% on Friday to ₹382.25 as it expected moderate growth of shipment volumes for the rest of FY23. The Gurugram-based company's stock is now below its IPO price of ₹487/share, which is a record low since it was listed on the bourses earlier this year. On Thursday, its shares plunged by 17.07%.

378.title: IAS officer Narain gets transit anticipatory bail in alleged rape case
378.article_body: Delhi HC granted transit anticipatory bail till October 28 to senior IAS officer Jitendra Narain for his alleged involvement in a rape case. "It wouldn't be appropriate to consider the allegations and counter allegations at this stage as it may prejudice the case of either party," HC said. Narain is accused of raping a woman in Andaman and Nicobar Islands.

379.title: Gurugram Police book banker & wife for cheating retired officer of ₹1 crore
379.article_body: The Gurugram Police booked a couple for allegedly cheating a retired central government officer of ₹1 crore on the pretext of investing his money in the share market. According to police, the prime suspect worked at a private bank while his wife was a sub-broker with an investment firm. The accused confessed to losing ₹1 crore in betting.

380.title: Important that UK finds stability as soon as possible: French Prez
380.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron said it was important that Britain found "stability as soon as possible" amid the resignation of British Prime Minister Liz Truss. "On a personal level, I am always sad to see a colleague go," he added. Liz Truss resigned as UK Prime Minister on Thursday after 45 days in office amid a massive economic crisis.

381.title: Governor seeks report on sexual assault of 4-yr-old girl in Hyd
381.article_body: Telangana Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan has sought a report from the state government on the alleged sexual assault of a four-year-old girl, an LKG student, at Hyderabad's DAV Public School by the principal's driver. Soundararajan called for immediate action against the perpetrator. The driver was arrested on Tuesday, while the principal was arrested for negligence a day later.

382.title: Harsha Bhogle names his all-time T20 World Cup XI; includes 1 Indian, 2 Pakistani players
382.article_body: Cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle has named his all-time T20 World Cup XI. Virat Kohli features as the only Indian, and Shahid Afridi and Umar Gul features as two Pakistani cricketers in his XI. He named Chris Gayle and Jos Buttler as the openers. Other players include Kevin Pietersen, Michael Hussey, Shane Watson, Lasith Malinga, Trent Bould and Samuel Badree.

383.title: India can't dictate how Pakistan will play cricket: Wasim Akram
383.article_body: Reacting to BCCI Secretary Jay Shah saying India won't travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023 and will look for a neutral venue, ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said, "India can’t dictate how Pakistan will play cricket." He added, "If Shah had to say something...he should've called PCB chief Ramiz Raja. There should have been a meeting of Asian Cricket Council."

384.title: Woman slaps guard, pulls female guard's hair as fight breaks out at Noida society
384.article_body: A woman was seen slapping a guard and pulling a female guard's hair after a fight broke out between two groups of residents at a society in Noida. The fight started at the Hyde Park society in Sector 78 over a residents' body election. Security guards were accused of manipulating the election and helping one of the groups.

385.title: Pic of close up of ant's face wins photography competition; people call it 'horrifying'
385.article_body: A picture of an ant's face, magnified five times under a microscope, has won the 2022 Nikon Small World Photomicrography Competition. Reacting to the picture by Lithuanian photographer Eugenijus Kavaliauskas, social media users wrote, "Horrifying," and, "Is this an alien?" Reacting to the comments, the photographer said, "There are no horrors in nature."

386.title: Earlier govts made fun of tribal traditions, we respect them: PM
386.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday laid the foundation stone of multiple development initiatives worth over ₹1,970 crore in Gujarat's Tapi and said that there are political parties who've a history of making false promises, however, BJP has always given priority to tribal welfare. "While earlier governments made fun of tribal traditions, we on the other hand respect...tribal traditions," he added.

387.title: 3 die of asphyxiation while cleaning drain at Pune residential society
387.article_body: At least three workers died of asphyxiation while cleaning a drain at a residential society in Pune's Wagholi area on Friday morning, a fire brigade official said. The victims entered the drain around 6 am and local residents informed the police and the fire brigade when they noticed that they were not responding around 7 am.

388.title: Chahal's wife Dhanashree trolls Urvashi with 'My heart led me to Australia' post
388.article_body: While going to join husband Yuzvendra Chahal for the T20 World Cup, choreographer Dhanashree trolled actress Urvashi Rautela in an Instagram post. Sharing a picture from a plane, Dhanashree wrote, "My [heart] led me to Australia, literally. Got to be there for my man." Earlier, Urvashi shared a flight selfie and wrote, "Followed my [heart]...it led me to Australia."

389.title: BJP responsible for garbage mountains in Delhi: AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj
389.article_body: After Union Home Minister Amit Shah accused AAP of step-motherly treatment towards the three municipal corporations in Delhi, AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj claimed that the BJP is responsible for garbage mountains in the national capital. "The BJP-led MCD was tasked with managing waste but still Delhi is categorised as one of the most unsanitary cities in our country," said Bharadwaj.

390.title: $40 bn wiped off digital ad firms' m-cap after Snap's revenue warning
390.article_body: After Snapchat-parent Snap on Thursday warned that it would see no revenue growth in the holiday quarter, shares of digital ad companies, including Meta and Google-owner Alphabet dropped by 4% and 2%, respectively. Snap's stock fell by 25%, while Pinterest's declined nearly 8%. The sell-off erased over $40 billion in market value from these firms and other internet ad companies.

391.title: Harry Potter-themed coins released in UK to celebrate 25 years of the series
391.article_body: The Royal Mint, which makes all the coins in the United Kingdom, has released Harry Potter-themed 50p coins to celebrate 25th anniversary of the publication of 'Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone' by JK Rowling in 1997. Royal Mint designer Ffion Gwillim, who modelled the artwork onto coins, said, "The Harry Potter illustrations are so iconic and recognisable."

392.title: IIT graduates' GlobalFair raises $20 mn in Series A funding round
392.article_body: GlobalFair, a B2B building material supplier started by two IIT graduates, Shaily Garg and Ashish Chandra, has secured $20 million in Series A funding round through equity and debt. Lightspeed Venture Partners led the funding round, which also saw participation from Saama Capital, Stride Ventures, India Quotient, and AUM Ventures.

393.title: Doctor, wife die by electrocution from geyser at Hyderabad apartment
393.article_body: A 26-year-old doctor and his 22-year-old wife reportedly died by electrocution from the geyser at their apartment in Hyderabad. The woman's father found the bodies of the couple in the bathroom. The police suspect that the woman suffered electric shock from the geyser first and her husband got electrocuted while trying to save her.

394.title: U'khand HC asks SIT to file status report in Ankita Bhandari murder case
394.article_body: Uttarakhand High Court on Thursday directed the Special Investigation Team (SIT) investigating the Ankita Bhandari murder case to file a status report along with the case diary. HC fixed November 3 as the date for the next hearing. This comes after a plea was filed by a resident of Pauri Garhwal seeking that the probe is handed over to CBI.

395.title: Jaffer lists T20 World Cup teams' weaknesses, trolls England for not having a PM
395.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to list T20 World Cup 2022 teams' weaknesses. He wrote, "India don't have a 150 kmph+ bowler. Pakistan don't have a seasoned finisher. New Zealand don't have great record in Australia. Sri Lanka don't have an experienced squad." Trolling England over the current political situation, he joked, "England don't have a Prime Minister."

396.title: I'm shaking, won't recover for another week: Kangana after watching 'Kantara'
396.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said that she was "shaking" after watching 'Kantara'. "What an explosive experience. Rishab Shetty, hats off to you...I heard so many people in the theatre say that they had never seen anything like this. Thank you for this film. I don't think I will recover from this experience for another week," she added.

397.title: CRPF constable rapes woman on pretext of marriage in Delhi; held
397.article_body: A CRPF constable was arrested for allegedly raping a woman multiple times in Delhi, police said on Thursday. The woman had filed a complaint against the accused claiming that he raped her on the pretext of marriage, according to police. Both the accused and complainant are in process of getting separated from their respective spouses, an officer said.

398.title: Major Mumbai roads, traffic islands to be illuminated between Oct 22-29
398.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to illuminate major public places, roads, traffic islands and other places in Mumbai between October 22 and 29, reports said. "Funds for these works have been classified as incidental expenditure to each ward office. Therefore, immediate action should be taken by calling for spot tenders," a BMC release said.

399.title: US diplomat's wife pleads guilty over UK car crash that killed teen
399.article_body: Anne Sacoolas, the wife of an American diplomat, pleaded guilty on Thursday to causing the death of a teenager by driving carelessly in England in August 2019. The 19-year-old, Harry Dunn, was killed when his motorcycle was hit by Sacoolas' car near a US military base in Northamptonshire. Following the incident, Sacoolas fled the UK under diplomatic immunity.

400.title: Liz Truss entitled to ₹1 crore/year for life despite only serving 45 days as UK PM
400.article_body: Liz Truss is entitled to £115,000 (over ₹1 crore) per year for the rest of her life as a former Prime Minister, despite only being in office for 45 days. Truss, who became the shortest-serving leader in British history, resigned amid massive economic crisis. She had defeated Indian-origin Rishi Sunak in the UK PM race.

401.title: Student ends life over fear of not getting job placement in Pune
401.article_body: A 22-year-old student allegedly died by suicide on Thursday over the fear of not being able to get a job placement in Pune. The deceased, who was studying design at a college in the city, was under immense pressure for the past few days, police said. The police have not revealed whether a suicide note was recovered from the deceased.
